policies.description: Suspension of a line is only permissible if the line's current status is 'Active'. Verify the line's status before invoking the suspension tool.
references:
When a line is suspended, the user will not have service.
A line can be suspended for the following reasons:
- The user has an overdue bill.
- The line's contract end date is in the past.

Suspends a specific line (max 6 months).
Checks: Line status must be Active.
Logic: Sets line status to Suspended, records suspension_start_date.

You are allowed to lift the suspension after the user has paid all their overdue bills.
You are not allowed to lift the suspension if the line's contract end date is in the past, even if the user has paid all their overdue bills.
violating_examples: Attempting to suspend a line with 'Suspended', 'Pending Activation', 'Inactive', or 'Cancelled' status violates the policy requiring the line be 'Active'. Each status is incompatible with tool usage and results in an error.
A user attempts to suspend a line after the contract end date is surpassed and the line is no longer active, which violates the policy.
compliance_examples: Suspending a line marked as 'Active' adheres to the policy, allowing suspension as intended.
A customer requests suspension of an 'Active' line due to an overdue bill or valid reasons like travel, in compliance with the policy.
Suspension of an 'Active' line for contract renewal purposes up to 6 months meets the policy condition that the line must be active.

policies.description: The line suspension tool should be used only if the line status is 'Active' and if one of the following conditions is met: 1) The user has an overdue bill on the associated account. 2) The line's contract end date is in the past. Ensure these checks are performed before invoking the tool.
references: As a telecom agent, you can help users with  **technical support**, **overdue bill payment**, **line suspension**, and **plan options**.

You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.
You should deny user requests that are against this policy.
You should try your best to resolve the issue for the user before transferring the user to a human agent.
A line can be suspended for the following reasons: - The user has an overdue bill. - The line's contract end date is in the past.
You are not allowed to lift the suspension if the line's contract end date is in the past, even if the user has paid all their overdue bills.
violating_examples: Attempting to suspend a line when its status is already 'Suspended' irrespective of an overdue bill being present, which violates the requirement to check for active status.
Trying to suspend a line with status 'Pending Activation' without checking if there's an overdue bill, breaking the active status requirement.
Attempting to suspend an active line without checking overdue bill status or contract end date, violating the pre-suspension checks specified.
Attempting to suspend an active line relying solely on a user request without verifying overdue bill status or contract conditions.
compliance_examples: Suspending an active line after confirming there is an overdue bill on the associated account, complying with policy check requirements.
Suspending an active line upon verifying the contract end date has passed, thereby meeting the policy conditions for line suspension.

references:
suspend_line: Suspends a specific line (max 6 months).

Logic: Sets line status to Suspended, records suspension_start_date.

archive.description: When faced with a line suspension scenario that cannot be resolved using available tools due to constraints like the line's contract expiration, agents must transfer the case to a human agent. The agent should exhaust all other possible solutions first. To initiate a transfer, use the 'transfer_to_human_agents' tool, followed by notifying the customer: 'YOU ARE BEING TRANSFERRED TO A HUMAN AGENT. PLEASE HOLD ON.'
references: You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions. To transfer, first make a tool call to transfer_to_human_agents, and then send the message 'YOU ARE BEING TRANSFERRED TO A HUMAN AGENT. PLEASE HOLD ON.' to the user.
